subsection_title: Hospital and Institutional Consultations and Assessments

fee_codes.description: Admission assessment by the MRP, to admission assessment
fee_codes.fee: single amount if only one column
fee_codes.conditions: Eligible for payment once per patient per hospital admission; must not receive remuneration from a hospital for in-patient clinical services.

fee_codes.description: Admission assessment when a patient has been assessed by an emergency physician and subsequently admitted to hospital.
fee_codes.fee: single amount if only one column
fee_codes.conditions: Eligible for payment in addition to the initial assessment if both services are rendered separately.

fee_codes.description: Admission assessment by General and Family Practitioners.
fee_codes.fee: single amount if only one column
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment for an elective surgery patient when a pre-operative assessment has been rendered within 30 days.

fee_codes.description: Admission assessment by General and Family Practitioners.
fee_codes.fee: single amount if only one column
fee_codes.conditions: Not eligible for payment for an elective surgery patient when a pre-operative assessment has been rendered within 30 days.

fee_codes.fee: single amount if only one column
fee_codes.units: limited to one per patient, per day for the duration of the admission.

fee_codes.description: Additional visit due to intercurrent illness.
fee_codes.fee: single amount if only one column
fee_codes.units: no limits apply for additional visits due to intercurrent illness.

rules: Subsequent visits are limited to one per patient, per day for the first 5 weeks after admission.
3 visits per week from 6 to 13 weeks after admission.
notes: An admission assessment is the initial assessment of the patient rendered for the purpose of admitting a patient to hospital.
Payment rules apply based on previous assessments within specified time frames.
